name: 陳岡伯
objective: n the second semester, apart from further refining students' writing skills (in the modes of classification and extended definition), the course will also introduce key theoretical approaches in literary and cultural studies to help students establish their arguments and methodologies of their senior projects. Students will read excerpts from original theoretical texts and critical essays that involve theoretical frameworks and write a full research paper at the end of the semester.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to the course and reviewing the common errors/defects in the 2 essays written in last semester  
Week 2: Classification essay: exercise  
Week 3: Extended definition: exercise
Week 4: Introduction to theories, methods of critical reading, psychoanalysis
Week 5: Psychoanalysis
Week 6: Psychoanalysis
Week 7: Feminism & queer studies 
Week 8: Feminism & queer studies
Week 9: Feminism & queer studies
Week 10: Power & discourse 
Week 11: Power & discourse
Week 12: Power & discourse
Week 13: Postcolonial studies 
Week 14: Postcolonial studies
Week 15: Postcolonial studies
Week 16: final group exercise
Week 17: Individual presentations
Week 18: Individual presentations
scorePolicy:
Two essays: 60%
Individual presentation: 20%
Participation (including assignments): 20%
materials:
All materials will be provided by the instructor.

Theoretical texts:
Sigmund Freud, "The Ego and the Id," "The Ego and the Super-Ego"
Simone de Beauvoir, "Introduction" to The Second Sex
Michel Foucault, Excerpts from Discipline and Punish
Edward Said, "Introduction" to Orientalism

Films for discussion:
Thelma & Louis
The Birdcage 
M. Butterfly
